gurmukhi: KulY Kwn KUnI Kurwswn K`gM ]prI ssqR DwrM auTI Jwl A`gM ]
transliteration: Khulai Khaan Khoonoo Khuraasaan Khadganng|| Daroo Sastra Dhaaran Outhoo Dhaal Aggadg||
translation: In the hands of blood-thirsty Khans, there were the Khorasan swords, whose sharp edges flashed like fire.

gurmukhi: BeI qIr BIrM kmwxM kV`ky ]igry bwj qwjI lgy DIr D`ky ]17]
transliteration: Bhaoo Toor Bhooran Kamaanan Kadakke|| Gire Baaj Taajoo Lage Dhoor Dhakke||17||
translation: The bows shooing out volleys of arrows twanged, the splendid horses fell because of the heavy blows.17.

gurmukhi: bjI Byir BuMkwr Du`ky ngwry ]duhUM Er qy bIr bMky bkwry ]
transliteration: Badoo Bher(i) Bhounkaar Dhoukke Nagdare|| Duhoon Or Te Boor Banke Bakdare||
translation: The trumpets sounded and the musical pipes were played, the brave warriors thundered from both sides.

gurmukhi: kry bwhu AwGwq ssqRM pHwrM ]fkI fwkxI cwNvfI cIqkwrM ]18]
transliteration: Dare Baah(u) Aaghaat Sastran Prahaaran|| Dakoo Daakanoochaanvadoo Chootkaaran||18||
translation: And with their strong arms struck (the enemy), the witches drank blood to their fill and produced dreadful sounds.18.

gurmukhi: khw lgy brnn kroN micXo juDu Apwr ]
transliteration: Kahaa Lage Barnan Daron Machiyo Judh(u) Apaar||
translation: How far should I describe the great battle?

gurmukhi: jy lu`Jy ju`Jy sbY B`jy sUr hjwr ]19]
transliteration: Je Lujjhe Jujjhe Sabi Bhajje Soor Hajaar||19
translation: Those fought attained martyrdom, thousand fled away. 19.

gurmukhi: BijXo swh phwVqwjI qiRpwXM ]cilXo bIrIXw qIrIXw n clwXM ]
transliteration: Bhajiyo Saah Pahaadtaajoo Tripaayan|| Chaliyo Boorooyaa Toorooyaa Na Chalaayan||
translation: The hill-chief spurred his horse and fled, the warriors went away without discharging their arrows.

gurmukhi: jso f`FvwlM mDu`kr su swhM ]Bjy sMg lY ky su swrI ispwhM ]20]
transliteration: Jaso Dadhwaalan Madhoukkar Su Saahan|| Bhaje San Lai Ke Su Sdaroo Sipaahan||20||
translation: The chiefs of Jaswal and Dadhwal, who were fighting (in the field), left with all their soldiers.20.

gurmukhi: ckiRq coipXo cMd gwjI cMdylM ]hTI hrIcMdM ghy hwQ sylM ]
transliteration: Chakrit Chopiyo Channd Gadjoo Channdelan|| Hathoo Daroochanndan Gade Haath Selan||
translation: The Raja of Chandel was perplexed, when the tenacious Hari Chand caught hold of the spear in his hand.

gurmukhi: kirE suAwim DrmM mhw ros ru`iJXM ]igirE tUk tUk h√çY ieso sUr ju`iJXM ]21]
transliteration: Kario Suaam(i) Dharamannd Mahaa Ros Rujjhiyan|| Girio Took Took Hvai Iso Soor Jujjhiyan||21||
translation: He was filled with great fury, fulfilling his duty as a general; those who came in front of him, were cut into pieces nad fell (in the field).21.

gurmukhi: qhw Kwn nYjwbqo Awn kY kY ]hinE swh sMgRwm kO ssqR lY kY ]
transliteration: Tahaa Khaan Naijaabado Aan Kai Kai/ Hanio Saah Sanraam Kau Sastra Lai Kai||
translation: Then Najabat Khan came forward and struck Sango Shah with his weapons.
